Articles.Content:
**Voyager Replica**

Another underrepresented craft on the forums, the Voyagers shook off the surly bonds of Earth and revealed a solar system (and beyond!) full of wonder. Voyager 1 did flybys of Jupiter and Saturn, then only several years ago became the first human object to leave the solar system and enter interstellar space. Unfortunately, we only have Jool in our system, so no glorious ring shots.

**Craft Info:** 79 parts, 2 tons

**Craft Download:** (Mediafire) [Link](https://www./?6zs92ndy8958x85)

Pics:

![jGEEN39.png](http://i.imgur.com/jGEEN39.png)

![WvWrquF.png](http://i.imgur.com/WvWrquF.png)

![bEisrMy.png](http://i.imgur.com/bEisrMy.png)

Thanks for viewing, and leave some rep if you enjoyed! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Is it actually balanced? That's been the #1 reason why I've never made a Voyager replica: They are unbalanced.

I think the actual *Voyager* was unbalanced too, but it still bothers me...
It's pretty balanced, I had no problems flying it. Cubic struts don't weight much.
Very nice as always. And for Saturn, you could install Outer Planets mod which adds Saturn and some moons to KSP.

> 
> It's pretty balanced, I had no problems flying it. Cubic struts don't weight much.

I don't think cubic struts weigh anything. They are physicsless parts, so their "mass" isn't added to the craft.
Your replica looks really cool ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I like how you've done its RTG with landing legs
